Question: Two persons A and B are sitting on either side of a See-Saw. Person A is having more weight than Person B, it is an equation.
Solution_text:
Since, we know that, an equation is defined as a mathematical statement consisting of two algebraic expressions having the same value
So, in an equation there is always an '=' sign and the expression on the right hand side of the '=' sign is called the RHS. The expression on the left hand side of the '=' sign is called the LHS.
Therefore, according to the question, LHS is equal to RHS
Thus, Two persons A and B are sitting on either side of a See-Saw. Person A is having more weight than Person B will not form an equation
